UOL (Brazil) - 3 years ago when Kia Joorabchian overthrew Gustavo Arribas, (former partner), and becoming Coutinho's agent, #LFC got worried

In one of the conversations in which #LFC made their wish to keep the player clear, Coutinho’s camp was told: “we won’t sell even for €500m

Kia is the one who took Willian for medicals at Tottenham. Hours later, he signed with rival Chelsea. UOL

Another disagreement occurred with Alex Ferguson, who lost Manchester United's Carlos Tevez to the archrival Manchester City.

They say Coutinho gave Klopp his word that he'll be available for training and games. They are kind of blaming Kia for the transfer request

Liverpool goalkeeper Danny Ward seeks talks with Jurgen Klopp after being the odd man out on opening day


Liverpool goalkeeper Danny Ward will seek talks with manager Jurgen Klopp this week after missing out on the club's opening game of the season against Watford.

Ward, who played for Wales at Euro 2016 and helped Huddersfield win promotion to the Premier League last season, was left out of Klopp's 18 at Vicarage Road on Saturday with Simon Mignolet and Loris Karius given the nod instead.

With Huddersfield manager David Wagner still interested in taking him back, 24-year-old Ward is anxious to seek assurances from his Liverpool manager that staying at Anfield won't mean a wasted season as the club's third-choice goalkeeper.

Ward was Huddersfield's promotion hero in May by making important penalty shoot-out saves in both the Championship play-off semi-finals and final.
Huddersfield have subsequently signed Danish goalkeeper Jonas Lossl on loan from Mainz but it's uncertain how he will cope with the demands of a full Premier League campaign.

Klopp is adamant he wants three senior goalkeepers at his disposal this season with Liverpool back in Europe but his closer personal friendship with Wagner means a deal may be reached where the Anfield club have a recall clause.
